snippet: President Obama formally triggered the across-the-board reductions late Friday night after failing to persuade Congressional Republicans to replace them with a mix of cuts and tax increases.
abstract: Pres Obama formally triggers across-the-board reductions after failing to persuade Congressional Republicans to replace them with mix of cuts and tax increases; across the country, impact of sequestration appears to be as varied as thousands of federal programs, big and small, that now have less money.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Robbie Brown from Atlanta; Will Carless from San Ysidro, Calif.; Ian Lovett from Los Angeles; and Marc Santora and Ravi Somaiya from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Obama formally triggered the across-the-board reductions late Friday night after failing to persuade Congressional Republicans to replace them with a mix of cuts and tax increases.

headline.seo: Sequestration Takes Effect, but Impact Is Not Immediate
headline.main: Across-the-Board Cuts Take Effect, but Their Impact Is Not Immediately Felt
headline.print_headline: Across-the-Board Cuts Take Effect, but Their Impact Is Not Immediately Felt
